timeline.bodyText: If bypassCache is null, shouldn't this be "false" instead of "true"?  Also, rather than parse the boolean, I would look for "true" and set it or otherwise it should always just be false (regardless of the value).

timeline.bodyText: I'm not sure we want this particular Map class (which is a JAX-RS dependency) to be required outside elide-core.   We may want RequestScope to keep the headers private and instead have a public method to ask for a particular header.
timeline.author: aklish

timeline.bodyText: Rather than redefine these methods twice, let's put them in a common class (HeaderUtils) or something like that.
timeline.author: aklish

+    public void jsonApiGetTestNoCache(@Autowired MeterRegistry metrics) {
+
+        Map<String, String> requestHeaders = new HashMap<>();
+        requestHeaders.put("bypassCache", "true");
+
+        given().headers(requestHeaders)
+        .get("/json/stats?fields[stats]=measure")
+        .then()
+        .body(equalTo(
+                data(
+                        resource(

-                )
-                .statusCode(HttpStatus.SC_OK);
+                        )
+                ).toJSON())
+        )
+        .statusCode(HttpStatus.SC_OK);
+        assertFalse(metrics
+                .get("cache.gets")

+                .functionCounter().count() > 0);

timeline.bodyText:
We can commonize this logic with HeaderUtils.
Spring has a class called HttpHeaders and JaXRS has a class called MultivalueMap.  Both extends Map<String, List<String>> .
We can commonize removing auth headers and the like by using the Java standard.
This means requestScope should probably have a Map<String, List> instead of a Multivalued map.
timeline.author: aklish

timeline.message: Merge branch 'elide-5.x' of github.com:yahoo/elide into CARBON-371
